conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, G, or H) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

The image shows four points labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, connected to colored baffles (green, yellow, orange, pink) that direct liquid flow downward. Four containers labeled E, F, G, and H are at the bottom, each aligned with a baffle.
Liquid flows out from points A, B, C, and D.
Liquid from A flows into the green baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from B flows into the yellow baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from C flows into the orange baffle and continues downward.
Liquid from D flows into the pink baffle and continues downward.
The green stream (from A) flows into container E.
The yellow stream (from B) flows into container F.
The orange stream (from C) flows into container G.
The pink stream (from D) flows into container H.
Final answer: A flows into container E, B flows into container F, C flows into container G, and D flows into container H.
